name: Slide Show
description:
Slide Show is a simple yet powerful utility that lets you turn any page of unlinked frames into a slide show presentation that you control while others watch in real time.


It's easy:


  1. Rename your frames in alphabetical order (numbers appear before letters).
  2. Turn off visibility for frames you don't want to show.
  3. Share your prototype link or embed to viewers.
  4. Start the Slide Show plugin and be amazed!


Navigate from frame to frame, or restart your slide show. (To start from a specific frame, select it before running the plugin.)


Keynote Live and PowerPoint Present Live are neat, but Figma's now a viable alternative, thanks to this plugin.


  • Ditch screen shares and present crisp graphics!
  • Embed your slide show anywhere!
  • Multiple frame sizes? Easy peasy!
  • Forget complex transitions. Less is more!
  • Live editing of slides? Yes!


For best results, use a Figma prototype link (or embed) with these parameters: scaling=contain and hide-ui=1. This ensures viewers see content at the largest size possible with minimum distraction.


Important: When using Slide Show, you must remove all Flow starting points on your page. However, you CAN keep existing prototype interactions in place! This is brand new to Figma and amazing!


Tip: For presenter notes or other content that's not viewable by readers, simply place them on the background canvas. Just make sure it's not in a frame.


While anyone can use this plugin, it was built especially for LexGo to easily control guided presentations designed in Figma.


NEW FEATURES!

Jump to Slide: Navigate to any slide quickly!


Random Slide: Great for quizzes and flash cards!


Hide Slide: Great for running through a presentation and hiding unwanted slides quickly.
